DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Sorry to bother you, then.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll let you get back to work, then.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: If you're busy, that's one thing, but I don't care for your tone.
RESPONSE TEXT: My tone?
There's no need to take offense. As you can clearly see, I'm deeply involved in some rather complicated mental equations.
Now, how about I get back to those and you get back to whatever it is you're doing.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll let you get back to work, then.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Someone's a little full of himself.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hardly. There is no place for ego in science.
I am simply trying to tell you, in as polite as manner as possible, that I am busy.
Now, goodbye.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll let you get back to work, then.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Working on something important?
RESPONSE TEXT: *Sigh* All of my work is important.
Now, if you're quite finished, I'd very much like to get back to these mental equations.
They're difficult enough without the distractions.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll let you get back to work, then.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll let you get back to work, then.
RESPONSE TEXT: Good.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Those mental equations will get a lot tougher after I sock you in the jaw.
RESPONSE TEXT: Er, what? Now just a moment. There's no need to get angry.
If an apology will suffice to stem your anger, then I'll offer it.
So nice talking to you. Goodbye!

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What a charmer.
RESPONSE TEXT: If that was an attempt at humor, I'm afraid it's lost on me. I'm much too preoccupied with my equations.
And now, if we're quite finished here, I'll return to them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Equations for what?
RESPONSE TEXT: *Sigh* Honestly, you wouldn't understand them.
Now I'm afraid I must end this little chat, although it's been so very diverting.
Well?
SCRIPT NOTES: Awaiting an answer. Wondering why the player has stopped talking.

RESPONSE TEXT: Yes, yes, I'm sure that whatever you have to say is very interesting, but now simply isn't a good time.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Sorry to bother you, then.

RESPONSE TEXT: Months of my life's work wasted because you couldn't take your job seriously.
You're not here to sabotage more of our work, I hope?
I'm still angry about Warwick Homestead. I see no point in hiding it.
I'm sorry, but I'm too preoccupied for chit-chat.
Director Holdren seems very taken with you.
Please resist any urge you might feel to eat the specimens in the hydroponic garden.
Most men lack the patience to observe and document plant growth.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: PlayerVoiceFemale01: I delivered the seeds.
RESPONSE TEXT: Good, good. I trust everything went smoothly?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Yeah, pretty much.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCMIsaacKarlin: You made a real mess of things at Warwick Homestead.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh yes, we know all about what happened.
I told you to be discreet and you blatantly disregarded that directive.
Now what do you have to say for yourself?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm sorry. I guess I just lost control.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm sorry. I guess I just lost control.
RESPONSE TEXT: That's hardly a satisfactory explanation.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Your carelessness has jeopardized months of research.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I don't owe you an explanation, doctor. You have no authority over me.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Your carelessness has jeopardized months of research.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Look, sometimes things don't go the way you planned. That's life.
RESPONSE TEXT: Is that supposed to excuse your behavior?
How disappointing. I hoped you would at least have the sense to take responsibility for your actions.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Your carelessness has jeopardized months of research.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How did you know what happened up there?
RESPONSE TEXT: We monitor our surface operations carefully.
If you think you can sabotage our efforts and get away with it, you're very mistaken.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Your carelessness has jeopardized months of research.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That's hardly a satisfactory explanation.
RESPONSE TEXT: Your carelessness has jeopardized months of research.
The entire project will have to be suspended indefinitely, at best.
In the meantime, I suggest that you think very carefully about whether you truly belong here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Yeah, pretty much.
RESPONSE TEXT: Splendid, splendid.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Here you are then, something to aid in your future missions, courtesy of the BioScience Division.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Hardly.
RESPONSE TEXT: Don't tell me the simple act of carrying a packet of seeds from point A to point B proved difficult for you, hm?
On second thought, don't answer that. You'll just discourage me.
I have little enough faith in people as it is. I'd prefer not to lose any more.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Here you are then, something to aid in your future missions, courtesy of the BioScience Division.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Not sure I'd call it smooth, but it's taken care of.
RESPONSE TEXT: Good enough, I suppose.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Here you are then, something to aid in your future missions, courtesy of the BioScience Division.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Does it really matter how smoothly it went?
RESPONSE TEXT: Being a member of the Institute means holding yourself to a higher standard.
It means efficiency and diligence, attention to detail and an exacting thoroughness.
It's not enough just to do a job. It must be done well.
At any rate, I'm sure you did the best you could.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Here you are then, something to aid in your future missions, courtesy of the BioScience Division.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Splendid, splendid.
RESPONSE TEXT: Here you are then, something to aid in your future missions, courtesy of the BioScience Division.
That will be all, thank you very much. Goodbye.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Now listen closely, because this next part is vitally important.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Just give me the seeds.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Seeds for what?

The fruit it bears will be perfectly healthy and edible. Or so I hope.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Isaac: Now listen closely, because this next part is vitally important.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Isaac: I trust that it won't.
RESPONSE TEXT: Now listen closely, because this next part is vitally important.
When Roger asks how your trip was, tell him some Bloodbugs chased you halfway across the Commonwealth.
That code phrase will identify you as an agent of the Institute.
Also, you must be discrete! Do nothing to draw attention to yourself or raise suspicion.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I understand.
SCRIPT NOTES: Emphasize "must". Be insistent, urging caution, this is important.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: A code phrase? What a joke.

I need your assistance with a simple errand on the surface. Allow me to explain.

I need your assistance with a simple errand on the surface. Allow me to explain.

RESPONSE TEXT: You made a real mess of things at Warwick Homestead.

RESPONSE TEXT: Remember, use discretion! We don't want to blow our synth's cover.
Warwick Homestead is on Nut island. Just look for the old waste treatment plant.
Bit of a blunt instrument, aren't you? Kellogg was much the same. Very well then, down to brass tacks.
*Sigh* How unsurprising.
No doubt Doctor Holdren preferred to boast about the importance of the BioScience division rather than tell you the details of my situation.
The man is useless, I tell you. Very well, I suppose it falls to me.
Frankly, I resent Doctor Holdren claiming that I "need help". There's a subtle insinuation there that I don't care for.
I simply require your services to make a delivery to one of our operatives on the surface.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Clayton: Well, that's a question best left to our colleagues in the Robotics division.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yes, well... I suppose you're right.
Have you had time to examine my latest reports on batch two-seven-four?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Clayton: Not yet. I've been reviewing Father's plans to expand our operations at Warwick.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Clayton: He's eager to get that going, so I've had to put everything else to one side.
RESPONSE TEXT: I wonder how the Warwick family is doing. Young Wally must be close to ten years old by now.
It's remarkable that any child can survive for so long up there.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Clayton: I... try not to think too much about it. We have more than enough to occupy ourselves here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Clayton: Those people are the last remnants of a dying past. It's best not to dwell on the subject.
RESPONSE TEXT: They're still people, and they're suffering. We can at least admit that it's regrettable.
After all, how can we hope to redefine mankind if we can't even hold on to our own humanity?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Clayton: Well, that's a question best left to our colleagues in the Robotics division.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Clayton: Did you add those new strains of triacanthos we discovered to the database?
RESPONSE TEXT: Yes, Doctor Holdren, it's taken care of.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Clayton: Good man, good man.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Clayton: Did you add those new strains of triacanthos we discovered to the database?

DIALOGUE AFTER: Clayton: Good man, good man.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Clayton: Good man, good man.
RESPONSE TEXT: The compliment is quite unnecessary, Doctor Holdren.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Clayton: Good man, good man.
RESPONSE TEXT: Thanking a man for doing his duty is like thanking a dog for barking.
Doctor Volkert, one of my valeriana officinalis specimens is missing. Do you know anything about it?

I was surprised when Father named you as his successor, but I'm sure he knows what he's doing.
